text: "The Three Little Pigs" is a fable/fairy tale featuring three pigs. They each build houses of different materials. A big bad wolf (the villain or bad guy) is able to blow down the first two pigs' houses. The first is made of straw, the second is made of sticks. But he is unable to destroy the third pig's house. This is because it is made of bricks. The moral or lesson of the story is to plan ahead.Scott T. Allison; George R. Goethals, Heroes: What They Do and Why We Need Them (New York: Oxford University Press, Inc., 2011), p. 33 Printed versions of the story date back to the 1840s.Cynthia Swain, Cynthia Swain (New York: Benchmark Education Company, LLC., 2009), p. 7 But the story may have borrowed parts from older stories. One is The Wolf and the Seven Young Kids ().The Annotated Classic Fairy Tales, ed. Maria Tatar (New York; London: W.W. Norton & Company, 2002), p. 208 This is a German folktale collected as the fifth tale in Grimms' Fairy Tales in 1812. The phrases used in the story, and the various morals that can be drawn from it, have become a part of Western culture.Encyclopedia of Psychology and Religion: L-Z, eds. David A. Leeming; Kathryn Madden; Stanton Marlan (New York: Springer, 2010), p. 600 Walt Disney made an animated version of the story. It features the song, "Who's Afraid of the Big Bad Wolf?" == Characters == * The Big Bad Wolf * The Eldest Pig (House of straw) * The Second Pig (House of sticks) * The Youngest Pig (House of bricks) * Mother Pig == References == Category:Fairy tales
title: The Three Little Pigs
